parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To irritate, provoke, be angry. From orge; to provoke or enrage, i.e. become exasperated.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sink, set, set during, go down. From epi and duno; to set fully.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Exasperation, wrath, irritation, indignation. From parorgizo; rage.
